declarations.description: Custom event type for the AST
declarations.name: NodeEvent

members.name: cancelBubble
members.description: If you are in a parent element and set this to true it will not bubble

members.name: cancelBroadcast
members.description: if you are in a child element and set this to true, the event will not broadcast downwards

declarations.description: Simulates a tree which can handle events and broadcast events to all nodes
declarations.name: EventTreeNode

members.name: moveNode
members.description:
move the position of an item from an index to an index.

Keep in mind that this is not swaping!

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5306680/move-an-array-element-from-one-array-position-to-another

members.name: addChildProperty
members.description: shorthand function to add a property as child node

members.name: addEventListener
members.description: Add a listener to a node

members.name: removeEventListener
members.description: Removes the listener from a node

members.name: broadcastEvent
members.description:
Broadcast the event to node and all childNodes and their childNodes
Bubbling is ignored, but propagation can be stopped

declarations.description:
This class stores your environment data,
- like the api services and types, which is used by the data components
- the current locale, which is used by the i18n package
- the acceptLanguage, which is used by the data components
declarations.name: Env
i18n

declarations.description:
`Iconset` class , works together with `furo-icon`

to use furo-icon you should
first import a svg set of icons and register it to Iconset

The complete [list of the built in icons](?t=demo-FuroIcon-0) can be found here.

the set of icons can be defined in a iconSetName.js file which has content like this:

```javascript
    export const iconSetName = {
         "iconName":"<g><path d='M12 xx.... z'></path></g>",
         "left-arrow":"<g><path d='M12 xx.... z'></path></g>"
         ...
    };
```

then import the iconset and register it

```javascript
import {iconSetName} from "./iconSetName";
import {Iconset} from "@furo/framework/src/furo.js";
Iconset.registerIconset( "iconSetName", iconSetName);
```

after registering you can use those icons in furo-icon in any other component

```html
<furo-icon icon="iconSetName:iconName" ></furo-icon>
```


Icons from the default set can be used without the set name:
```html
<furo-icon icon="iconName" ></furo-icon>
```
declarations.name: Iconset
Init

members.name: addApiTypeSpec
members.description:
Add a single type spec to the registry

Attention: If the name already exist, the old entry is overwritten.

members.name: addApiServiceSpec

Add a single service spec to the registry

Attention: If the name already exist, the old entry is overwritten.

members.name: applyCustomApiPrefixToServicesAndTypes
members.description: Apply the prefix to all service deeplinks and to all furo.Reference types with defaults

members.name: translateStaticTypeMessages
members.description: Translates spec content like meta.label, hints
